Module count
Package count.gui.kit

Class DiscreteDistributionPlot

java.lang.Object
count.gui.kit.DiscreteDistributionPlot
All Implemented Interfaces:
Icon
public class DiscreteDistributionPlot
extends Object
implements Icon
A plot (Icon) illustrating the point mass function for a discrete distribution.
Author:
Miklós Csűrös

  • Constructor Details

    • DiscreteDistributionPlot

      public DiscreteDistributionPlot​(DiscreteDistribution D, int width, int height)
      Fully parametrized instantiation.
      Parameters:
      D - a discrete distribution what we want to plot
      width - width of the plot (pixels)
      height - height of the plot (pixels)

    • DiscreteDistributionPlot

      public DiscreteDistributionPlot​(DiscreteDistribution D)
      Instantiation width default size.
      Parameters:

    • getIconHeight

      public int getIconHeight()
      Specified by:
      getIconHeight in interface Icon

    • setBackground

      public void setBackground​(Color c)
      Sets the bakground color for the plot. By default, this is null, meaning that no background is painted (transparent icon).
      Parameters:
      c - a color (null means default behavior)

    • setLegendColor

      public void setLegendColor​(Color c)
      Sets the color for the axes, and parameter info. By default, this is null, so no legend is painted.
      Parameters:
      c - a color (null means default behavior)

    • setPlottingColor

      public void setPlottingColor​(Color c)
      Sets the plotting color. By default, this is the same as the legend color
      Parameters:
      c -

    • setDistribution

      public final void setDistribution​(DiscreteDistribution D)
      Sets the distribution that is to be plotted here.
      Parameters:
      D - a discrete distribution (Poisson, NegativeBinomial or PointDistribution)

    • setRange

      public void setRange​(int range_min, int range_max)
      Sets the range for the plot: probabilities for n=range_min,range_min+1,...,range_max are plotted.
      Parameters:
      range_min - minimum value (inclusive) for which probability is plotted.
      range_max - maximum value (inclusive) for which probability is plotted.

    • paintIcon

      public void paintIcon​(Component ignored, Graphics g, int x, int y)
      Plots the distribution at a given location.
      Specified by:
      paintIcon in interface Icon
      Parameters:
      ignored - this parameter is ignored, may be even null (required parameter for Icon interface)
      g - graphics context (should be convertible to Graphics2D)
      x - coordinate for the left-hand side
      y - coordinate for the top
